fields.description:
When editing an unordered list in a table cell, changing the font color seems to break the wiki markup for the unordered list. I attached a movie to show what happens.

1. two cells, mostly identical content.
2. select text in right cell, change color.
3. everything looks right in the RTE, so I save.
4. unordered list has collapsed into asterisks.
fields.summary: Changing font color breaks unordered list

fields.description:
If you run Confluence without user property caching, it does around twenty database hits per request to check whether the current user is disabled or not. This is the deactivated check in UserAccessor.isSuperUser() method, which gets called for most permission checks in Confluence.

We should cache the result of this check for each request so we only need to check whether the user is disabled once.

This fix will involve moving the isSuperUser check into the PermissionManager so that we don't need to add caching in all the calling code or in the UserAccessor which currently has none.
fields.summary: Cache result of isSuperUser check in permission handling

fields.description:
Confluence checks the user's language preference more than a hundred times during a typical request.

We have a cache for language preference for users to help the performance of this, but it currently only stores entries for users that have a specific language selected. We should improve the caching so that it stores the fact that a user has the site default selected, if the user has no preference.

This reduces the need for PropertySet caching provided by Atlassian-User.
fields.summary: Improve caching of language preference when user is using site default language

fields.description:
In Confluence 2.5.7 in websphere 6.1 when using IE, if you click on ppt file, it would open automatically 
After upgrading to 2.10.4, when you click on the file, IE will ask if you want to open or save file.

fields.description:
After upgrading to Confluence 3.1, applying my old changes to the footer-content.vm and header.vm templates, the footer will render at the bottom of the browser frame or at the bottom of the page's content if it is smaller than the browser window is high.  It looks like the footer still has adequate space at the very bottom of the page, the content just doesn't render there.  I've also tried changing footer.vm but it has the same effect.  It's also worth noting that making the footer any taller than the default causes the bottom of some pages (the dashboard is an example) to be clipped off by a few pixels.  Nothing is completely covered, just partly.

After restoring the .vm files that shipped with 3.1 the problem went away on some pages, but still exists on others (despite it just using the default footer).  I can't find any sort of recognizable pattern and unfortunately I can't attach any screenshots...
fields.summary: Page footer renders incorrectly

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18052].
  {panel}

To replicate:

# Create a page called roi. Add the text boi and toi.
# Search for the term boy, roy or toy.

Notice that the word ending in i is highlighted as a match. The reverse works as well. 

This does not occur if the i or y is in the middle of the word.

fields.description:
It would be great if there was a simple way to give a view permission (on a page) to a specific user group - for example just through checking a box on a specific page.

In our case, we are thinking of integrating our partners (which would then be all in one user group) into our wiki by granting them view permissions to some specific pages. Currently, our partners don't have any access rights at all.

I don't know of a plugin that is able to do this.
fields.summary: Page level permission to a user group

fields.description:
The help text on the left of the "Manage Referrers" screen is incorrect and misleading. It tells you to turn the "Record External Referrers" option *ON* to prevent the recording of referrers. In fact, you should turn the option off. The text also says that the default value is "OFF', but I think the default is "ON".

The text also does not mention the second option that allows you to prevent the display of the referrers while retaining the ability to record the referrers.

Suggested help text for the screen:

{quote}
*Record External Referrers*:
Turn this option off if you want to prevent Confluence from recording the external URLs that link to Confluence pages.

*Show Referrers in Page Info*:
If this option is turned on, the 'Info' screen for each page will display a section called 'Hot Referrers', showing the top 10 external links pointing to that page. Turn the option off if you want to record referrers (see above) but prevent the display of 'Hot Referrers'.

*Excluded External Referrer Prefixes*:
Here you can specify a list of blocked URLs. Any incoming links from URLs that match the list will no longer be recorded. Use the following characters to separate domain names: space, tab, new line, colon or semi-colon. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Fix misleading text on referrers admin screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18040].
  {panel}

People cannot find other people because they do not know that a name is written with an umlaut or accent.
I think it is perfectly reasonable for a confluence user to expect that the search string 'rene' also finds the person 'René' and that a search for 'ozgur' also finds the person called 'Özgür'.

People suggesting that names with diacritic marks should be entered into Confluence without the diacritic marks, I kindly ask to crawl back in time a few decennia when the American Standards Association could use some help developing ASCII. The use of Unicode is not uncommon anymore, and this problem can be solved in a better way:

1. The preferred solution would be to implement a way to remove diacritic marks from a letter, so you can reduce a string with diacritic marks to a string without diacritic marks. A search string would then not only be compared to a persons name, but also to the reduced version of that name.

2. A work-around would be to create a new user property, besides 'fullname', that can contain alternative spellings of this persons name. Someone called René could enter 'Rene' as alternative spelling. A search strings would then not only be compared to a persons name, but also to the alternative spellings of that name.

More information:
- My support ticket describing the problem: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-40233
- Google demonstrating that you can strip the umlaut: http://www.google.nl/search?q=Dani%C3%ABl
- A solution in Perl: http://ahinea.com/en/tech/accented-translate.html
fields.summary: Finding people with names with diacritic marks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18029].
  {panel}

Congratulations on delivering a wonderful improvement to the Office connector plugin with Confluence 3.1. I really enjoy the new features and no bugs yet :-)

However, on the Word/Powerpoint page rendering one issue that still makes life difficult is the incomplete rendering/display support for Word/Powerpoint documents containing Text Boxes. 

In 1.6 it shows the text within the boxes at least but its mostly all left justified and there are no box outlines, or Word autoshapes or graphic objects such as box join lines or arrows displayed.

Above: think a flowchart done in Word with text boxes and arrows - thats what I'm trying to display in rendered in a Confluence page.

I know the above can be done in Gliffy or embedded as a JPG in the word doc but we have 1000's of Word and Powerpoint documents containing text box content and converting them will take a long time, and in some cases such as ISO 9000 documents we always want to store everything in the Word document since there is (as yet, hint, hint!) no way to export pages from Confluence (e.g. PDF export) with headers, footers, proper pagination, etc suitable for such "controlled" documents.

This missing Word/Powerpoint text box support from the Office connector is restricting further application of Confluence in our business. Please consider this feature request ASAP.
fields.summary: Word/Powerpoint text box and autoshapes support still lacking from Office connector page rendering in Confluence 3.1

fields.description:
If the jiraissuesmacro is given bad parameters or if the jira instance it is running against is faulty, then it can end up displaying a 500 error screen within the macro.  Tomcat's 500 error screen, at least the one from this server at the moment, includes a style tag like this:

{noformat}
<style><!--H1 {font-family:Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif;color:white;background-color:#525D76;font-size:22px;} H2 {font-family:Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif;color:white;background-color:#525D76;font-size:16px;} H3 {font-family:Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif;color:white;background-color:#525D76;font-size:14px;} BODY {font-family:Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif;color:black;background-color:white;} B {font-family:Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif;color:white;background-color:#525D76;} P {font-family:Tahoma,Arial,sans-serif;background:white;color:black;font-size:12px;}A {color : black;}A.name {color : black;}HR {color : #525D76;}--></style>
{noformat}

That style gets applied to the whole Confluence page.

This could be fixed in at least these ways:
* Checking for error results and not displaying the 500 page inline
* Stripping style tags from external content displayed by the jira issues macro
fields.summary: Jira Issues Macro with error makes headings look ugly

_#Confluence 3.1 would be even better if Atlassian called the installation types "Evaluation" (not standard) and "Production" (not custom)._ - http://twitter.com/movito/status/6474148211

fields.description:
Switching between wiki markup editor and Rich editor will cause extra escape characters added to pages when the bold and strikethrough  surround a macro 

Steps to replicate the problem:
# Create a page in a space
# Switch to wiki markup editor
# Copy the following code:
{code}
-{macro}-
*{macro}*
{code}
*NOTE:* You will need to change the {macro} to some other syntax which fits your environment
# Switch to Rich text Editor and return to wiki markup again
fields.summary: Adittional escape character added when bold and strikethrough surround a macro

Given the old interface allowed you to do this, users will be accustomed to typing usernames, and we should support this.

The second seems to be outdated and I'm not sure if it's even needed.

Thanks,
Maleko

The orphaned pages list on the listorphanedpages.action contains edit and remove actions in the last column. The display of those action links is not checked for the actual permissions. If the user does not have the deletion or editing permission, the links should not be shown.

There should be included some simple permission checks in the common-listorphanedpages.vm template.
fields.summary: Orphaned pages list actions do not depend on actual permissions

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18003].
  {panel}

* Use the Windows Evaluator, and go to the 'Choose Components' screen
* Position the mouse over the component 'Confluence Core'

The description given is currently "Confluence Evaluation 3.1"

This is simply repeating what the user already knows - we should provide a better description of the product in this space.

fields.description:
* Use the Windows Evaluator, and go to the 'Choose Components' screen
* Deselect 'Confluence Core'

As this is the only component, it should be mandatory to install it.  Currently, it is possible to deselect it, and the wizard allows you to continue until the end (and so nothing will be installed).

Expected: The 'Next' button should be greyed out when no components are selected.
fields.summary: Windows Evaluator: Wizard does not force user to install Confluence Core

fields.description:
"small_*.png" versions of the Macro Browser macro icons we created in images/icons/macrorowser/20px for the Insert Menu when the plan was to allow users to set the macros that appeared in the menu and have icons for each.

The macros can still be customized via web-resources but the icons can't, so we don't need these resources and if we end up needing them later we should create a sprite.

  {panel}

    * Go to a Space containing attachments
    * Select 'Browse' -> 'Attachments'

Expected: The user should be able to sort the list by any of the columns.

Current: All columns are sortable except for 'Creator' and 'Attached To'.
fields.summary: Browse: Attachments: Should allow sorting by 'Creator' and 'Attached To' columns

fields.description:
* Go to a Space containing attachments
    * Select 'Browse' -> 'Attachments'
    * Click on a column to sort by it

Expected: There should be an arrow to indicate the column which is being sorted on.  This would make it consistent with the Page Attachments screen, which does show the sorted column. See screenshots.
fields.summary: Browse: Attachments: Current sorted column is not indicated for space attachments, which is inconsistent with page attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17985].
  {panel}

* Go to a Space containing attachments
* Select 'Browse' -> 'Attachments'
* Enter 'doc*' into the 'File Extension' filter.


Expected: This should return a list of all the attachments with extension '.doc' and '.docx'.

Current: No matches are returned. This means that to find all doc files, the user must first search for 'doc' and then repeat the search for 'docx'.

fields.description:

* Click on 'Creation Date' to sort.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17976].
{panel}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Ensure you have hooked up your install to mysql
 # Create a user
 # Let that user create a comment in a page
 # Let that user edit that comment and save
 # Log in as admin and try to remove the user created at 1)

h3. Expected behavior

User get deleted
h3. Actual behavior

The following error is thrown
{code:java}
2009-12-04 15:52:49,748 ERROR [http-8080-1] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/admin/users/viewuser.action?username=partha | url: /admin/users/removeuser.action | userName: wikiadmin
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'isUserRemovable' in  class com.atlassian.confluence.user.actions.RemoveUserAction threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at /admin/users/removeuser.vm[line 31, column 23]
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:252)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.evaluate(ASTReference.java:460)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTNotNode.evaluate(ASTNotNode.java:63)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.evaluate(ASTExpression.java:62)
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateSpaceDao.mySqlGetSpacesContainingCommentsByUser(HibernateSpaceDao.java:222)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateSpaceDao.getSpacesContainingCommentsByUser(HibernateSpaceDao.java:192)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.DefaultSpaceManager.getSpacesContainingCommentsBy(DefaultSpaceManager.java:309)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:20)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy35.getSpacesContainingCommentsBy(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserContentManager.getUserCommentedSpaces(DefaultUserContentManager.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserContentManager.hasAuthoredContent(DefaultUserContentManager.java:17)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:20)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy58.hasAuthoredContent(Unknown Source)
{code}
This will fail on:
{code:java}
            spaces.add(comment.getPage().getSpace());
{code}
in {{com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateSpaceDao#mySqlGetSpacesContainingCommentsByUser}}

as

{{comment.getPage()}} will be null for the original comment (i.e. the comment that was edited).

Database (truncated):
||CONTENTID||CONTENTTYPE||VERSION||CREATOR||LASTMODIFIER||LASTMODDATE||PREVVER||PAGEID||
|23592962|'COMMENT'|2|'partha'|'partha'|'2009-12-04 15:33:55'|(null)|23396354|
|23592963|'COMMENT'|1|'partha'|'partha'|'2009-12-04 15:33:42'|23592962|(null)|

Notice that the pageid for the editted comment is null.

We should either set the pageid for comments that are edited, which won't help for comments that have already been edited, or we simply assume that comments with no page, are old comments and skip them.
h3. Workaround

(!) This SQL query will not work in Confluence 5.3 and above
 # Enable [SQL logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Enabling+Detailed+SQL+Logging] as per to obtain the username of the user being deleted. If you already know the username then proceed to next step.
 # Remove all Comments associated with the user in the BodyContent table:
{code:java}
DELETE FROM BODYCONTENT WHERE CONTENTID IN (SELECT CONTENTID FROM CONTENT WHERE CREATOR='<NAME>' AND CONTENTTYPE='COMMENT');
{code}

 # Remove all Comments associated with the user in the Content table:
{code:java}
SELECT CONTENTID FROM CONTENT WHERE CREATOR='<NAME>' AND CONTENTTYPE='COMMENT';
{code}
fields.summary: NPE when removing a user which has created a comment that has been edited

fields.description:
If you move from the wiki markup editor to the rich text editor within one editing session (i.e. without saving), you lose some edits.

To reproduce:
# Create a new page and put some text in the body. Save the page.
# Edit the page using the wiki markup editor.
# Remove the content of the page.
# Go to the rich text editor.
# The content re-appears.

fields.description:
The new 'Move Page' dialog box only allows you to move a single page or family of pages to a different parent page (within the same or a different space).

However, it would be good if this dialog box could also incorporate the page rearrangement/reordering functionality of the old page move feature (in Confluence 3.0 and earlier) and allow you to effectively 'drag and drop' one or more pages without having to go to the space's 'Tree' view to do it.

The 'Tree' view is currently the only option for reordering pages in Confluence 3.1 now.

Hence, could we implement a 'reorder page' feature into the 'Move Page' dialog box? Perhaps add this as a new option below the 'Browse' option and call it 'Re-order pages'. However, allow the user to move more than one page at a time.

We should also include alphabetical sort and 'undo' sort options too.
fields.summary: 'Move Page' dialog box cannot rearrange/reorder pages like the old page moving feature in 3.0 did.

fields.description:
The page order seems to be randomly set to a random order sometimes. I've noticed it a couple of times, and so has another tech writer, but without being able to pin it down.

Now there's a very good example: the child pages of the Crowd Release Notes page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Crowd+Release+Notes
The release notes should be in reverse order, from most recent downwards. They were in that order last time I looked. Now I've just created the new page for Crowd 2.0.2. I dragged that page to its place at the top of the tree. But before dragging, I had already  noticed that the other pages are out of order. I am purposely not putting them back into the correct order in case this will help with the diagnosis of the problem. :)
fields.summary: Page order seems to randomly re-arrange itself

A drop-down or similar would be a great enhancement.

fields.description:
Dear Confluence Support, I discovered 3 software bugs inside the „edit in Word" function: If the Confluence User opens a page in MS Word: The html tag

is correctly presented within Word. But when the Document is stored back to Confluence, normal paragraphs are changed to simple line breaks
. You will see it if you take a look into the generated HTML code of Confluence. Additionally, because Word starts up with a standard format template there is no space after a paragraph. The intelligent user would then insert 2 line breaks within Word and save the document back to the server. Confluence will then render the page with a new CSS style attribute sample text sample text
sample text Additionally, soft line breaks "SHIFT+Enter" within Word are totally ignored from Confluence. Used Hardware: Confluence 3.0 Internet Explorer 6 Microsoft Word XP (2002)
fields.summary: After editing a Page in MS Word, paragraph information replace by line feed

fields.description:
Following on from CONF-17119...

When changes are made to whitespace on a Confluence page, the notification email does not contain these changes, but the online version diff does.

If only whitespace changes are made to a page and a notification email is sent, the email says that the page was edited, but then says "Changes (0)". If the user clicks "View Changes" in the email, he/she is taken to an online page, which is in the same format but includes the whitespace changes.

It would be less confusing to have this be consistent.
fields.summary: Notification of white-space changes differs between email and online diff
